top.description:
This file carries all the configuration options for running Tari-related nodes and infrastructure in one single file.
As you'll notice, almost all configuration options are commented out. This is because they are either not needed, are for advanced users that know what they want to tweak, or are already set at their default values.  If things are working fine, then there's no need to change anything here. Each major section is clearly marked so that you can quickly find the section you're looking for.
 A note about Logging - The logger is initialised before the configuration file is loaded. For this reason, logging is not configured here, but in `~/.tari/log4rs.yml` (*nix / OsX) or `%HOME%/.tari/log4rs.yml` (Windows) by default, or the location specified in the TARI_LOGFILE environment variable.

message_cache_size.name: Message cache size
message_cache_size.description: Tari is a 100% peer-to-peer network, so there are no servers to hold messages for you while you're offline. Instead, we rely on our peers to hold messages for us while we're offline. This settings sets maximum size of the  message cache that for holding our peers' messages, in MB.

message_cache_ttl.name: Message cache TTL
message_cache_ttl.description: When storing messages for peers, hold onto them for at most this long before discarding them. The default is 1440 minutes = or 24 hrs.

mode_timeout.name: Mode Timeout
mode_timeout.description: Parity will move to inactive mode after {} seconds.

base_path.name: Base Path
base_path.description: Blockchain and settings will be stored in {}.
